description: Modern scientific work relies heavily on electronic circuitry and computation. This course examines the fundamentals of analog and digital electronics, explores the applications of discrete and integrated circuits, and introduces the broad topic of computer control of experiments. Students develop hands-on skills in circuit building, computer interfacing, and programming in LabViewÂ®. Students attend one laboratory period each week. Prerequisite: PHYS 125 or PHYS 131. Offered alternate years; next offered in 2014-15.
name: Electronics
notes: Students in Physics 246 must also register for lab Physics 246 L.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: PHYS 125 or PHYS 131. Offered alternate years; next offered in 2014-15.
